title: Assessment of Mitochondrial DNA Content and Mass in Macrophages
procedures: Quantification of mitochondrial DNA contentPrepare bone marrow-derived macrophages (BMDM) in 24 well plates (1 x 106 cells per each well, medium volume: 1 ml). Please refer to Chen (2012).Briefly, primary BMDM are differentiated for 5 days in M-CSF-containing medium.Remove the M-CSF-containing medium and then wash the adherent cells with 500 μl PBS three times. Add a fresh culture medium to exclude diverse alternative effects by M-CSF and FBS.After 24 h, BMDM were stimulated with lipopolysaccharide (LPS, 100 ng/ml) for the various time points in the incubator at 37 °C (Figure 1).Remove the supernatant and then wash the adherent cells in 500 μl PBS.Remove PBS leaving behind the adherent cells.Add 300 μl cell lysis buffers, pipette three times to lyse the adherent cells, and then transfer into a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.Add 1.5 μl RNase A solution to the 1.5 ml tube containing the cell lysate and then incubate for 30 min in a heat block at 37 °C.Chill samples on ice for 5 min, add 100 μl protein precipitation (PPT) buffer into each sample, and vigorously mix by a vortex mixer for 30 sec.Centrifuge at 16,000 x g for 5 min and transfer 300 μl of the supernatants into the a new 1.5 ml tube.Add 300 μl of 100% isopropanol and then gently mix the samples containing the DNA and protein pellet by inverting several times.Centrifuge at 16,000 x g for 1 min, remove the supernatants, and then add 1 ml 70% ethanol to wash DNA (white pellet) in each tube.Centrifuge at 16,000 x g for 1 min, remove the ethanol, and dry the DNA pellet by leaving the cap open for 10 min.Incubate the DNA samples into 100 μl DNA rehydration buffer at 65 °C for 1 h using a water bath or heat block.

In this case, we generally obtained 10-20 μg DNA from 1 x 106 cells. Prepare DNA mixture for Real-Time PCR analysis as follows:10 μl 2x SYBR green PCR master mix2 μl DNA samples (50 ng/μl)1 μl Forward primer (10 μM)1 μl Reverse primer (10 μM) 6 μl DEPC waterPerform quantitative Real-Time PCR cycling follows:95 °C for 10 min40 cycles95 °C for 10 sec60 °C for 30 sec72 °C for 30 sec72 °C for 10 min4 °C holdThe quantification of mitochondrial DNA contents was calculated by the mitochondrial (mND-1) to nuclear DNA (mPyruvate kinase) ratio (Figure 1).imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/20171025/20171025223125_1547.jpgFigure 1. TLR4 stimulation resulted in enhanced mitochondrial DNA content in macrophages. BMDMs were stimulated with LPS (100 ng/ml) for the indicated durations. Cells were collected and then analyzed by quantitative real-time PCR for measuring mitochondrial DNA content in BMDMs. The mitochondrial DNA content (mND-1) was normalized to the nuclear DNA (mPyruvate kinase).Mitochondrial DNA massPreparation of bone marrow-derived macrophages (BMDM) in 24 well plate (1 x 106 cells per each well, medium volume: 1 ml).Remove the supernatant and then add 1 ml fresh culture medium in each well. After 24 h, BMDM cells are stimulated with LPS (100 ng/ml) for 6 h.Remove the supernatant and wash the adherent cells with 500 μl fresh PBS 3 times.Add 500 μl culture medium containing MitoTracker Green FM (Working concentration: 200 nM).Incubate the samples at 37 °C for 45~60 min.Remove the culture medium and wash the cells with 500 μl fresh PBS.Add 500 μl accutase into each sample.Transfer each sample to the FACS tube and centrifuge at 16,000 x g for 5 min.Remove the supernatants and wash the cells with 500 μl fresh PBS.Carefully replace the PBS with pre-warmed growth medium containing 3.7% formaldehyde at 37 °C for 15 min or at 4 °C overnight.

Total fluorescence of MitoTracker Green FM is measured by flow cytometry (Figure 2). imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/20160503/20160503001433_4130.jpgFigure 2. TLR4 stimulation resulted in enhanced mitochondrial DNA content in macrophages. BMDMs were stimulated with LPS (100 ng/ml) for 6 h. Cells were collected and then assessed by a flow cytometry analysis to measure Mitotracker fluorescence signals (Left). Live cells were assigned according to size and granularity (Right). Histogram of MitoTracker Green FM signal indicates the cell counts that correspond to the fluorescence intensity of mitochondrial mass.
